body_html:
Hi Luisa! I am not sure if you access to the CI details, but in case not: here is the failing spec

  1) Role create when the user is added as a student does not send a notification
     Failure/Error: expect(RoleMailer).to_not have_received(:user_added_to_team).with(subject)
     
       (RoleMailer (class)).user_added_to_team(no args)
           expected: 0 times with arguments: (#<Role id: 1, team_id: 1, user_id: 1, name: "student", created_at: "2017-11-09 11:09:15", updated_at: "2017-11-09 11:09:15", state: "confirmed", confirmation_token: "cb0f42079448300e">)
           received: 1 time
     # ./spec/models/role_spec.rb:83:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'
Finished in 1 minute 44.6 seconds (files took 5.03 seconds to load)
1456 examples, 1 failure, 1 pending
Failed examples:
rspec ./spec/models/role_spec.rb:82 # Role create when the user is added as a student does not send a notification

FYI
You can run the specs locally with
$ bundle exec rspec
and you can run the single file by adding the path:
$ bundle exec rspec spec/models/role_spec.rb
or a single spec by adding the line number:
$ bundle exec rspec spec/models/role_spec.rb:83

Don't hesitate to ping me if you get stuck.

body:
Hi Luisa! I am not sure if you access to the CI details, but in case not: here is the failing spec
```Failures:
  1) Role create when the user is added as a student does not send a notification
     Failure/Error: expect(RoleMailer).to_not have_received(:user_added_to_team).with(subject)
     
       (RoleMailer (class)).user_added_to_team(no args)
           expected: 0 times with arguments: (#<Role id: 1, team_id: 1, user_id: 1, name: "student", created_at: "2017-11-09 11:09:15", updated_at: "2017-11-09 11:09:15", state: "confirmed", confirmation_token: "cb0f42079448300e">)
           received: 1 time
     # ./spec/models/role_spec.rb:83:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'
Finished in 1 minute 44.6 seconds (files took 5.03 seconds to load)
1456 examples, 1 failure, 1 pending
Failed examples:
rspec ./spec/models/role_spec.rb:82 # Role create when the user is added as a student does not send a notification
```
FYI 
You can run the specs locally with 
`$ bundle exec rspec`
and you can run the single file by adding the path:
`$ bundle exec rspec spec/models/role_spec.rb`
or a single spec by adding the line number:
`$ bundle exec rspec spec/models/role_spec.rb:83`
 
Don't hesitate to ping me if you get stuck.
